instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00923-a not turning on.
threads.message:
Board with water damage. 

There was a short on PPBUS. 

Changed U7900 and U800 ( were bad)


Now getting: 

PPBUS,  3V3_S5/SUS. Checked big coils and no pulse. On charger i get 20V and stack at 0.04 AMPS.

threads.title: 820-00923-a not turning on.
threads.message: Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.

threads.title: 820-00923-a not turning on.
threads.message:
Sorry for delay. Customer asked me to stop repairing ( financial issues :D). No we retake it. 


Yes when i triger SMC_ONOFF_L  PM_PWRBTN_L drops from 3.3 to 0.3V

threads.title: 820-00923-a not turning on.
threads.message: Check if PM_SLP_Sx_L signals pulse at same time.

threads.title: 820-00923-a not turning on.
threads.message: PM_SLP_S5_L - missing and shorted but PM_SLP_SUS_L- 3.3V. May i inject voltage?

threads.title: 820-00923-a not turning on.
threads.message:
Exact ohm resistance to ground at PM_SLP_S5_L?
Allow 10-15s after power is removed...

threads.title: 820-00923-a not turning on.
threads.message: Sorry, i was wrong.  PM_SLP_S5_L  is not shorted and has 100Kohms to ground. but 0V

threads.title: 820-00923-a not turning on.
threads.message:
"Yes when i triger SMC_ONOFF_L  PM_PWRBTN_L drops from 3.3 to 0.3V"
PM_SLP_S5_L and PM_SLP_S4_L pulse at same time???

threads.title: 820-00923-a not turning on.
threads.message: No, Both stay 0.0V. Only PM_PWRBTN_L drops down

threads.title: 820-00923-a not turning on.
threads.message:
Then you have a PCH issue.
Check PCH's RTC and PM_DSW_PWRGD signals.

threads.title: 820-00923-a not turning on.
threads.message:
PM_DSW_PWRGD  - 3.4V

RTC of PCH u mean this?:


RTC_RESET_L - 2.7V
PCH_SRTCRST_L - 2.7V


P.S. Seems that there was overload on PPBUS_HS_CPU because all points of componentes on that line seems be a bit other color ( like burnt), but i get 13V on that line.

Also if it can help: connecting charger i get 20V and about 0.10-0.11 Amps.

threads.title: 820-00923-a not turning on.
threads.message:
Still missing PCH_INTRUDER_L signal.
If good, then possibly bad PCH/CPU; check if PM_BATLOW_L goes high.

threads.title: 820-00923-a not turning on.
threads.message:
PCH_INTRUDER_L  - 2.5V
PM_BATLOW_L   - 3.3V


P.S. Also PPVBAT_G3H_CONN is a bit burnt but i get 12.5V. May be it damaged U7000? U7000 on this models comes with firmware, right? So i cannot just take it from any board, it must be same board.

threads.title: 820-00923-a not turning on.
threads.message:
U7000 is good, as you get correct PPBUS_G3H.

Looks like bad PCH...

threads.title: 820-00923-a not turning on.
threads.message:
Nothing more to check than?

if not, do u knowanhthing about dara recovery machine for this models? I saw there was a device that recover data from faulty logic board

threads.title: 820-00923-a not turning on.
threads.message:
The boards with Lifeboat connector, offer the option to recover SSD data with special tool.
Only if there is not a problem with SSD power rails.

threads.title: 820-00923-a not turning on.
threads.message:
Could u explain me
More please? Where i can get that tool?
